principle number two is this is that our clients defend themselves from failure so that in the condition at which some
service a downstream service is not responding correctly in that large distributed system with complex
distributed failures if something's not working we basically expect it not to work and we do our best to try to
provide something useful for the person who is trying to interact with us so we have things like fallbacks and circuit
